mods.abstract: Manuscript land surveys made chiefly by Vicente Pintado and Charles Trudeau, royal surveyors of Louisiana and East and West Florida during the Spanish colonial period, office of the Surveyor General of Louisiana.
mods.note:
Manuscript land surveys (in French and Spanish) made chiefly by Vicente Pintado and Charles Trudeau, royal surveyors of Louisiana and East and West Florida during the Spanish colonial period, and at one time constituting part of the Official records of the office of the Surveyor General of Louisiana.

The former Survey of Federal Archives in Louisiana prepared translations of all documents and tracings of all maps, plats, and plans in these 15 manuscript volumes. Typescripts of these translations and tracings, and a history of the Pintado Papers are bound in 11 volumes.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
